Text: Our greatest strength is our unity. In Munich, we affirmed that our NATO alliance and relationship with the transatlantic community are strong and united.
On my visit to Munich, we strengthened and affirmed relationships with our allies and partners worldwide as we demonstrated our unity in the face of Russian aggression.

More than 42 million people in our country do not have access to high-speed internet. 

That’s why our Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will expand internet access, lower prices for internet service, and help close the digital divide.

The Affordable Connectivity Program means that more entrepreneurs can build digital businesses, and more children can do their homework at home.

If you believe you are eligible to receive affordable broadband support, visit https://t.co/viMAVwZGRV.

More than 10 million American households have signed up for the Affordable Connectivity Program, which lowers high-speed internet costs for working people. 

Visit https://t.co/viMAVwZGRV to see if you are eligible. 
https://t.co/eo4NhgeCz9

In the 21st century, high-speed internet is a necessity. 

That’s why, since day one, the President and I have fought to make it easier for everyone to access and afford high-speed internet. Now, the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will help make it happen.

We’re not just getting rid of lead pipes. We’re creating jobs.

Through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, we will invest in job training, upgrade our workforce's skills, partner with our labor unions, and establish apprenticeships—all to create jobs replacing lead pipes.

Lead exposure affects multiple generations within one household.

Grandparents shouldn’t have to worry about their grandbabies drinking water poisoned by lead, especially during their formative development years. That's why we're working towards removing lead pipes nationwide.

For far too long, homeowners or renters have had to suffer the burden of investing their own money to fix lead service lines on their property. 

The investments in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will begin to change this by replacing lead pipes nationwide.
We must eliminate lead pipes. https://t.co/gCbTGYrtuf

We have made historic strides to strengthen the judicial bench, with over 70% of our nominees being women.

It's about time.

The Executive Order on Project Labor Agreements will ensure federal construction projects are built on time—improving construction work around the country and job quality for nearly 200,000 workers.

We’re fulfilling our promise to build a more skilled and productive workforce.

When the President and I took office, we understood the challenges facing our nation and planned to get America back on track.

While there's more work to be done, businesses and schools are back open, and America is getting back to work.

Americans are back at work at a record-setting pace. Our economy created 467,000 jobs in January, and 6.6 million jobs have been created since we took office.

While there’s more work to be done, we are focused on rebuilding an economy that will lift up all Americans.

The latest jobs report shows America’s economy created 6.6 million jobs within the last year, exceeding expectations. 

We are making historic strides to build our country back better than before.

Over the past two years, so many have lost loved ones.

Our faith has been tested. But it is that same faith—our faith in God, our faith in humanity, and our faith in what is possible—it is that same faith that has seen us through and helped us to see the light in one another.

These goals are not abstract. They will transform and save lives.

Since @JoeBiden and I took office, the economy has grown at the fastest rate in nearly 40 years.

There’s more work to do, but America is on its way back.

The John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act and the Freedom to Vote Act represent the first real opportunity to secure the freedom to vote since the Supreme Court gutted the Voting Rights Act.

We don't know when we'll have this opportunity again—the Senate must act now.

Make no mistake: There is nothing normal about laws that prevent the American people from exercising their constitutional right to vote. 

Two landmark voting rights bills sit before the Senate. The Senate must act to protect the will of the people. https://t.co/ijeYvXGiZF

We will fight to safeguard our democracy and secure our most fundamental freedom: the freedom to vote. 

The Senate must pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act and the Freedom to Vote Act to protect our right to vote.

The Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act are about ensuring that all Americans—wherever they live, whatever party they are registered to vote with—have the  ability to exercise their vote.

The Senate must act to protect this sacred right.

We must protect voting rights. 

That’s why the Senate must pass the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act to ensure that everyone can count on  access to the ballot box. https://t.co/1re8h3gpGa

Our democracy is being threatened by an attack on voting rights. 

We must fight to save our democracy by fighting for the right for all people, whoever they vote for, to vote.

For the sake of one of the most important pillars of our democracy, we must put politics aside, step up, and act. 

The Senate must pass the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act.

Activists and leaders including Dr. Martin Luther King, John Lewis, and Rosa Parks have fought to expand voting rights. 

We owe it to future generations to continue to fight for every American’s right to vote and have their vote counted.
